data.name: Sorting with alternation
data.description:
You're given array of objects. Each object contains at least three props 'room', 'type' and 'id'.
You should order items in the array as following:
1) Order all items by room in ascending order;
2) Within each room group order all items so that they're alternating with each other;
3) Make sure, that types have ascending order;
4) When alternating items within groups, keep initial order of items of the same type.

Your function shold return a string of ids, separated by :

ex.:

input: 
[
  { room: 1, type: "lub", id: 1 },
  { room: 1, type: "putil", id: 2 },
  { room: 1, type: "lub", id: 3 },
  { room: 1, type: "lub", id: 4 },
  { room: 1, type: "lub", id: 5 },
  { room: 1, type: "him", id: 6 },
  { room: 1, type: "him", id: 7 }
]

sorted: 
[
  { room: 1, type: 'him', id: 6 },
  { room: 1, type: 'lub', id: 1 },
  { room: 1, type: 'putil', id: 2 },
  { room: 1, type: 'him', id: 7 },
  { room: 1, type: 'lub', id: 3 },
  { room: 1, type: 'lub', id: 4 },
  { room: 1, type: 'lub', id: 5 }
]

output: '6:1:2:7:3:4:5'
